Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: highflierSussex
Reviews.Content: Nice room and excellent bathroom in this hotel. Tram stop straight outside the door, but it is about 20 minutes into Alexander Platz. The area looks a little grim initially - busy road, big Lidl across from the hotel, and a seeming dearth of bars. However, Prenzlauer Berg proper is to be found in the streets off Prenzlaur Allee to the right where there are some lovely spots to eat and drink, once you've found them this is a well placed hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “comfort and friendliness of this hotel in Berlin, germany”
Reviews.Author: biopharm34
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every time in Berlin on business. The hotel is extremely comfortable with very resonable room rates, excellent Breakfast and close to some very fine restaurants. The tram N-3 takes you right in to the heart of the city to enjoy the night clubs and fine dining. The hotel is not open for dinners. The senior staff memebers, Markus and Heiko are a gift to this clean, quiet hotel which is only approx Euro 20.00 taxi ride from Berlin Tegel Airport. The u-Bahn train station Prinzelauer Alle is 5 minutes walk which offers U-bahn and S-Bahn connections for every majot part of the city of Berlin. The only drawback is there are no iron or ironing boards in the rooms but the rooms are clean, elegant, and extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “More than value for money!”
Reviews.Author: MC1966Belgium
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel! And the fact their underground parking is the coolest underground parking I have ever seen has got nothing to do with the overall 5 out of 5 I give this hotel. The room was spotless, the breakfast fantastic (huge choice and loads of everything), staff was very efficient and very helpful and the location is just wonderful and practical with the tram just outside the front door. We loved the area (nice restaurants, cafes and little shops) and when visiting Berlin, you simply have to stay in the cool eastern part. If you can, bring your bicycle coz Berlin's flat so perfect form of transport. We are most definitely returning to Berlin and the Prenzlauer Berg Holiday Inn. We recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of spending some time in this wonderful and funky city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic hotel, very clean, well organised, the reception staff are extremly polite and accomodating. All the staff go out of their way to ensure you have a delightful stay. It is located 5 mins by tram from berlin centre and is close to the train station, making it easy to commute to the airport. Definitely would go again

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay for a great rate !”
Reviews.Author: N0rwegianTravellers
Reviews.Content: I have now been 4 times to this hotel over the last 2 years. My last visit was now in December for 2 nights. I choose this hotel for several reasons: Very good rate if you book early enough. You can get a room for 50-70 euro with or without breakfast. Choose with Breakfast as I think it´s very good ! Easy to get to from the Airports. From Schonefeld, you can get the S9 train which stops at the station 150m from the hotel. It cost around 3 euro. Good location if you like to explore the Prenzlauer Berg area. Very good breakfast for this standard of hotel. A large range of bread, fruit, all the different things you need for your meal and some good cakes to finish off with! The breakfast room have a good size and I have never had a problem to get a table. The rooms are of various sizes, but I have always had a good bathroom in the rooms I have stayed in. I would like to have a flatscreen TV in the room , as they have stlll oldfashioned TV's. Maybe an internett connection with a cable in the lobby would also be better than current WiFi system. I will always come back to this hotel, as I am very happy with my stays here !

Reviews.Title: “Nice & quiet, very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Naomi75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July 2011. It is about a 1/2hr comfortable and pleasant walk to the inner city and most of the tourist attractions. The room we had (on the 5th floor) was quite spacious and very clean with a king bed and extra single bed. Reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the variety of the breakfast buffet was huge - a good mix of traditional German cold meats and cheeses, as well as more International hot cuisine. The automatic parking elevator takes some getting used to and caused a couple of moments of unease, but as long as you have a relatively small car there is no need to worry. Overall, a wonderful stay - would definitely recommend If you are planning on dining here, although it is quite reasonably priced, there is not a huge selection on the menu, however there are a multitude of places to dine in the inner city. If you are a bit of a fitness fanatic and still like to work out on your holiday, the gym is very tiny - a couple of weight machines, a cross-trainer, and a bike.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect. Congratulation”
Reviews.Author: wh0s0ever
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights there as i was attempting the ITB. Everylittle think from the welcoming up till goodbyes were just awesome. the guys are very prfessionnel especially the (I think Egyption or Moroccan ...whatever) guy as front office manager...thank you all for your help. The shuttle service from & to ITB is as smart as convenient... I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ErMoviola
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife for a long weekend in Berlin. The hotel is conveniently located, not far from Tegel airport and close to public transport. The room we had was quite nice, clean and with enough space. The only downsides were that the bed was a bit small and the room was a bit hot at night. The staff at the hotel was always very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CroatiaGuide-writer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in leafy suburb, East Berlin, close to public transport, and a fabulous breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “good location,clean and spacious rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: daisyEssex
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights in a king bed deluxe room to accommodate 3 adults, the room was spacious, clean, with a good quality bathroom -only negative was that the room was a little hot at night.Our room did not face the street so was quiet. The location was excellent -easy to get into central Berlin and to Schonefeld airport (S9 from prenzlauer allee station 5 mins walk) and also the tram is right opposite the hotel which goes into Alexander platz. The area itself was very pleasant with several restaurants a 10 min walk away, lots of cafes and individual shops. Kollwitzplatz is a lovely square close by. We much preferred this to being in central Berlin and would recommend the hotel.The staff were really helpful. Also ideal for running as there is a large park relatively close.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ainparis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not centrally located - however there is a tram stop right in front of the hotel that takes you directly to Alexander Platz in 15 minutes and the SBahn is just one stop away. Prenzlauer Berg with lots of cute café's and restaurants is just a couple of stops away on the tram as well. The rooms are basic, but clean. If you get a room not facing the street, then it's nice and quiet. The bathrooms could use some updating especially the bathtubs which are old. I was traveling with 2 friends and the triple room we had was very spacious and comfortable. This place is fine if you are looking for an affordable place to stay and don't mind not being in the center of things.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: When we went there, the swimming pool was closed for maintenance. Top floor another issue. Rooms were ok but far too small for the price. On the other hand, the hotel was very convenient in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice and inexpensive hotel in a great location. We were a 5 minute walk from the u-bahn loop, which was 15 minutes from the airport (TXL). There was a grocery store across the street and an excellent kebab restaurant a couple of doors down that we went to 3 times! The hotel room was very modern and quite large. The hotel offered one hour of free internet each day and served breakfast for 10 euros. The hotel also had a mini gym, which we used once. The only downside to the hotel was that the air conditioning did not work and we had one very hot day in Berlin. Fortunately, the windows opened in the room, so we were able to cool off the room slightly at night. Also, our mini fridge broke on the 3rd day, so some of the food we had purchased spoiled. Other than that, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, spacious and clean.”
Reviews.Author: joanb255093
Reviews.Content: Well equipped, quiet setting, handy to excellent supermarket, good eating places and shopping. Not so easy to get into the city centre, but that was ok with us as we were visiting family nearby. The bathroom was a bit dark and German showers are a bit behind the times, but the water was hot and plentiful. Well equipped kitchen area, comfortable beds but very dim bedside lamps makiing reading in bed impossible. The tv was a bit temperemental and the sofa was actually another bed so not very comfortable to sit on. Free internet in the foyer was appreciated. Plenty of hanging space and room to stow suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it .”
Reviews.Author: gracepsc88
Reviews.Content: very good location. right in front of the hotel is a tram station.Very clean, front desk services also very polite. rooms got air corn. and breakfast also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sunshinetom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here end of may and the stay was great. From the first contact to check in and check out everything was great! The staff was very helpful and very friendly, though the breakfast ladies could have been a bit more smiley. But never the less it was worth the money. Great location, with the Tram only 10 minutes to the city centre, Alexander Platz and Main Station. Thanks for the Service!!

Reviews.Title: “Between average and very good = good”
Reviews.Author: epo376
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days. And overall the place deserves more than 'average', but 'very good' is too much: it is a 3 1/2 star Holiday Inn. The location is out-of-centre in a quiet neighbourhood, but the fine system of public transport in Berlin gets you [stop of tram M2 with very regular service just in front of the hotel] around all over town. Take the Berlin City Tour card for the best use. We had a room on the 6th floor: very basic. The beds were good, the tv wasn't (so we didn't get to the programs ....) and in the bathroom no bath, only a shower: although a good shower (and it was good) beats a bath with a poor shower. Towels were small and not renewed on a daily basis. Missing in the room was a safe: a place to store documents / valuables is almost mandatory, travelling these days. You can have an hour free on the internet, daily. Breakfast was ok: no luxuries but everything was there. Weekdays till 1030, in the weekends even until 12 o'clock. There is no real restaurant, just a snack-corner which we didn't use. The fitness-centre is really a mini-gym. If you are in the Priority Points-system, be sure to ask for a copy of the bill, as we did not find the points automatically on the account.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: lollypollyme
Reviews.Content: Effecient, inoffensive and good value. You have to try out the bizarre, mechanised, multi-level parking apparatus if you have a car. Was a whole new experience! Unless you actually want to hang out in the Prenzlauer district, you should note that there are better located (although more expensive) hotels in the city centre. However this hotel doesn't claim to be prime real estate right in the heart of Berlin, so I'm somewhat surprised at other tripadvisor reviews marking down the hotel on this basis.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was in a luxury hotel - fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: globalem
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days during my trip in February. When we got there we were a bit concerned about the location as there didn't seem to be much around other than a few shops. However, after finding our feet we realised what a great location this place is. It's a stones throw from the train station (very easy to get to from the airport) and there is a tram stop literally out the front. There is a lovely area near the hotel with some great restaurants - the Mexcian one is great (on a street called something beginning with Raumer Street) . The hotel itself was so nice - one of the nicest I have stayed in for a long time. Very clean - crisp white bedding and luxury bathroom. The staff on the front desk were so friendly - I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok”
Reviews.Author: piotrwasil
Reviews.Content: Rooms are average, you cannot expect anything fancy above the 3 star quality. Bathroom and room is clean, but you can see a bit the time. Unfortunately most of additional services are paid, therefore, if you don't get a good room rate, it's getting more expensive. I tried breakfast, there was a very good choice and a lot of different food, still, I had to pay 10 euro for it. I can recommend it, but in that range you can definitely find something better around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfest, wonderfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: barakl
Reviews.Content: Been there for 3 nights. The hotel is situated 3 minutes walk from the s train, and its just next to the tram. The hotel has internet access downstairs andprovides 1 hour free wireless connection for a room (above hour you have to pay). The breakfast was great - besides the regular food you can make your own pancake and enjoy fresh fruit salad etc. The only disadvntege is that the room was abit small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Highly Recommend It! Check out the Breakfast Too!”
Reviews.Author: Stew3219
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the above hotel while in Berlin for the 2010 Marathon. Was a little skeptical regarding the location, and how reasonable it was compared to the BIG name hotels we're familiar with. Staff, service, accommodations, were much better than I'd hoped for. Room housed 3 adults comfortably. Clean, up to date. Very friendly, helpful, all English-speaking. Good location. We took public transportation everywhere. Would recommend this to anyone unsure of booking a room overseas for the first time!

Reviews.Title: “Toll und Preiswertiges”
Reviews.Author: cajmere
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location for a business or pleasure trip to Berlin. Easy access to great shoping and restauarants, antique shops, cafes, parks, etc. The city has a wonderful public transportation system, and being close to ring subway and major tram lines is a great aspect to the hotel. The breakfast was surprisingly good and filling, you can almost skip lunch altogether. The rooms are simple but extremely clean and it was difficult to hear any noise from neighboring rooms. Very professional service. There is also internet in the lobby for free usage but can get crowded so recommend to pay for wireless instead. There is also a dry cleaning service that does express cleaning around the corner! Wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff; Good location for restaurants”
Reviews.Author: jwp48
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were very knowlegable and helpful with transport, entertainment and restaurant suggestions. Hotel is near S-bahn & tram stops. Good location for restaurants - a few tram stops to Kollwitzplatz etc. Modern, clean and efficient as expected from a Holiday Inn. Parking free on side streets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Convenient location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: MississaugaMoe
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Holiday Inn Berlin City Center East-Prenzlauer Allee in July 2010. The hotel was nice, quiet, and very clean. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. At first I was concerned that the hotel wasn't within easy walking distance of the major sites, but that turned out not to be an issue. The M2 tram stops right in front of the hotel and takes you to Alexanderplatz in about 10 minutes. You can get anywhere from there --- and easily too if you've bought a 48-hour or 72-hour transit pass. The hotel is not too far from two very attractive neighbourhoods that would be good choices for dinner (Prenzler Berg and Kollwitzplatz). We walked back to the hotel after dining in each location. All in all, the Holiday Inn Berlin City Center East is a good choice for a visitor to Berlin. We enjoyed our stay and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's clean, cheap and allright!”
Reviews.Author: Intelins
Reviews.Content: This is my first time ever in a Holiday Inn hotel, and I must say I very happy with my stay. The Hotel is approximately 500m away from the nearest S-Bahn Station, so all in all a good connection. The Hotel is clean, the rooms are of average size. Only negative point was that there was a tiny bit of mould in the bathroom & shower (enough to trigger my allergy). Something that did strike me was that the TV set was very old, but that's nothing serious. A good budget alternative for Berlin, in Prenzlauer Berg district.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: aoudjana
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect it to be so good, as I had to do the booking late in a very busy period in Berlin, but it was. The room was clean and very spacious. The staff very nice and extremely helpful. I had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel For A Couple Of Days In Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KimQueenofQuo
Reviews.Content: The hotel foyer was clean and bright. Checkin was slow but the receptionist was polite and helpful with directions and tour info /tram info. Our room was standard size with two single beds. Our window looked out onto the breakfast room glass roof a small. The bed was very comfortable but we had to ask for extra pillows. The room temperature was just right. The bathroom had a shower which worked great plenty of hot water and plenty of clean towels. Shampoo conditioners and soaps were available. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom. The only disappointment was there was no kettle in the room there was a coffee machine but it was very slow. The hotel also has a small gym but unfortunately as we only had two nights there we were in town for the Status Quo concert we did not have time to use the facilities. We opted for Breakfast which was nice. It cost Euro 9.50 There was a choice of german sausage bacon scrambled eggs and boiled eggs. There was also a very good choice of cooked meats hams salami and turkey. Plenty of swiss and dutch cheeses and pates. A variety of german bread and rolls. There was also a good selection of fruit juices teas and coffee. Cereal yoghurts and homemade cakes. The staff worked hard to keep it fully stocked our second morning was busy. There is a small foyer bar which we sat in after the gig and had beer which wasnt too badly priced and good quality. There was also free internet and free newspapers were available too. The tram directly outside the hotel takes you to Alexanderplatz in minutes and from here you can access anywhere in the city very quickly indeed. We brought a family dayticket which cost about Euro 5 and the trams run until 3am even on a Sunday! Thankfully we had booked a quiet room off the road. Nice hotel and the location was good for us near to the concert with very good transportation into the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “No way is this a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex81261
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and tidy. Bed separated into a twin in what was a double room no headboards. Extra pillows were not available in the room. Cold water pressure in the bathroom was appaling the shower near scalded me twice since no thermostatic valve was fitted and wter pressure was variable causing one minute cold the next boiling hot. Until improvements are made I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for touring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: infast
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here with my wife having a city break short holiday. After an initial heart attack when booking in, when the desk manager said we were at the wrong holiday inn!!! The stay was very pleasant indeed. We bought a 5 day Berlin welcome card at Tegel airport and used it to get to the hotel. The entire journey took less than 30 mins. The tram directly outside the hotel takes you to Alexanderplatz in minutes and from here you can access anywhere in the city very quickly indeed. The room was spacious,comfortable and clean. The breakfasts were a great spread of hot and cold food, enough to set you up for sightseeing days. A short walk brings you to an area full of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Flgirl01
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Excellent and helpful staff. Quiet. Air conditioned. Great area for shopping and dining, but not close to Berlin city centre. Prenzlauer Allee is a great place to stay. Convenient to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very unprofessional front desk at reasonably good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dilwala
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights but since we purchased through Priceline the front desk treated us as third grade citizens and was sarcastic many a times.If anything extra like pillow or sheet was asked they had excuses .When we asked If we can use their microwave to warm up our left over food for 2 minutes, they told us there would be extra charges for it.This displays how cheap the staff behaved.Also they forced us to stay in smoking room although we never smoked in our lives and never stayed in smoking room in any hotel..Hotel itself was reasonably clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: cjpaint
Reviews.Content: My parents and I traveled with my 1 year old son to Berlin. This hotel was convenient to public transportation. It was about a 10 minute walk to a nice restaurant district. The rooms were clean and well maintained. There is some street noise when you have the window open at night, but it is not overwhelming. The staff went out of their way to help me.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Holiday Inn - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Dufflecoat
Reviews.Content: If you dont want anything more than a normal standard Holiday Inn then this would be fine - but not for the holiday traveller - it's a little out of the way - half an hour by S Bahn and one change to the Centre. But if you dont mind that then it would be ok. On the plus side the S Bahn is only five minutes walk. I was transitting through Berlin and needed a reasonably priced hotel and at around 70 EURO this fitted the bill. Friendly staff! This is probably a business not tourist hotel - free wifi for an hour and then stupid charges after that! Some of the rooms facea noisy street but the double gazing seemed to work. Showers in the cheaper rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: mrscherry2000
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. Very convenient to the trolley and S Bahn just a few blocks. Neighborhood restaurants nearby. Direct shot to Alexanderplatz. Room was clean and modern. Bed comfortable. Only drawback was the location of my room but I didn't feel like moving so I stayed there. It was on the street side right next to a flag pole with a light on it all night. Could hear the Trolley until it ran way past midnight. They could just use some room darkening curtains on that side of the building. Staff very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. German restaurant down the street was excellent. Will have to find out the name and review later. Breakfast was GREAT! Don't miss it, well worth it. Large variety with many healthy options.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Georgi_dk
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this hotel by accident. Simply decided to drop by Berlin and used car's navigation system to find a hotel. I've picked three located relatively in the city center, called them up and Holiday Inn provided the best rate of 62 EUR per night plus 12 EUR for parking. I've stayed in quite a few budget hotels including Holiday Inn and I must say that this very hotel has exceeded my expectations. Room was just huge, very clean and the bathroom was something of a 5-star hotel. I used to judge hotels by bathrooms (and it seems like many other people too) and this is number two hotel bathroom in the list of nearly 30 I've seen. I did not try the hotel breakfast as I prefer to eat in my favorite places in the city, but I passed by the restaurant and it looks very decent. Among the down sides of this hotel I can only mention a few small things: quilt and location. The quilt is made of synthetic materials and therefore makes at night. As for the location - it's neither good nor bad. You'll have to take a tram (10 min ride) to get to Alexander Plads, which is not the center yet. It will take you another 10 minutes from Alexander Plads by metro to get to the center. Al in all, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel. Whenever I came again to Berlin, I will stay there again and I will gladly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “East Berlin Jem”
Reviews.Author: Cadmonkey
Reviews.Content: Rooms: The room was very nicely furnished with a TV. And the bathroom was large specious with the usually toiletries and a really good shower. Everything was also very clean and tidy. Staff: The staff were very good and nice and friendly with good English they made checking very smooth. Location: Right next to a tram stop and 5 mins from nearest train station a great quiet part of East Berlin a great place to explore the city from away from the hustle and bustle of the West. Food & Drink: We never ate at the hotel but from what I saw of the Breakfast in passing it looked nice. Overall: A great hotel if you want to be based in East Berlin and I would definitely stay there again when I return to the beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “City centre? 4 stars? I dont think so!”
Reviews.Author: jamesbrownuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located near the main tourist attractions as indicated. This could be overcome by providing a reasonable service which didn't happen. They could not find our booking for half an hour despite me having a confirmation from Easyjet. Then we were given twin rooms (not triple). When we pointed this out to recpeption they laughed (but did fix the problem). Rooms were basic but clean. I find it hard to understand how this is 4 star with in either provisions or service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meltwaterfalls
Reviews.Content: Yeah no problems really with this place, it was a standard hotel, it was pretty new so everything was decorated in a contem,porary fashion and there were no signs of wear and tear. The staff were very friendly and efficent, the rooms were a good size and beds very comfortable. No complaints at all really. The location was reasonably good, there was a tram stop outside and an S-Bahn Stop about a 3-4 minute walk away and once you were on them anywhere in Berlin was accessable. It was only a short stroll beofre you hit the shops and cafe's of Prenzlauerberg propper, which has a great'Alternative' feel to it, and is great for shopping in Independant shops. From the centre, say Brandenberg gate, it is about 15minutes by the very effective public transport. All in all a great standard hotel for a good price in an accesable location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Wales_UK
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times over the last few years. The staff are always very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast is really great too! The location is not in the city centre - that's why they call the hotel "City Centre East" - the clue is in the name! But you do get to stay in Prenzlauer Berg, and the tram stops literally opposite the front door - which is very convenient - a short ride from Alexander Platz. Or you could walk 4 mins to the nearest S Bahn. It's a great location for seeing the east side of Berlin, and easy to get to the city centre. It's great value too, considering it often costs only around 70 euros a night. We're staying again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: stuart462
Reviews.Content: Stayed six days here in Spring so got to know the hotel quite well. Immediate impression was that the staff were very pleasant and helpful and I was right to think so. The room was clean with a large bathroom and was a bit of an odd shape but somehow that grew on me. I paid around 70 euros per night which was about right. Breakfast was Hol Inn standard in a spacious breakfast room. About a five minute walk to the S-bahn, or go outside front of hotel for the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for budget minded visitors”
Reviews.Author: Steelydanman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay here over the weekend. This review will echo the positives of other contributions. This is a budget hotel and relative to that broad classification offers good value and comfort: Rooms - good size, comfortable if blandly furnished Bathroom - larger than normal for budget category Staff - at all times friendly, responsive and efficient Breakfast - good variety/quality Location - not a problem, yes its a residential area and may be not much to write home about but it wasn't noisy and we certainly felt safe enough. Personally, I cannot imagine how, with a tram stop right outside the door and an S-Bahn station 500m away, anyone could feel this was too far away from the Mitte, etc., its only a 10 minute tram ride to Alexanderplatz ! Downside - yes, the "bistro" is not great in terms of decor or menu but there are many good places to eat/drink a couple of tram stops away, i.e. within walking distance, e.g. Kollwitzstrasse, Knaackstrasse. If you don't want to walk more than 50m for food, get yourself a picnic from the Netto underneath or the Lidl over the road and eat in your room but that would be missing the variety of places down the road. We would stay here again for its combination of value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: jd1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in April 2007. The Hotel itself was great - clean, nice room, great buffet breakfast included and friendly staff. However its location is a good 20 minutes away from anything that you want to see. I wouldn't stay here again because I would want to stay closer to the city and to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very Uneven”
Reviews.Author: jp7124
Reviews.Content: A nice property, but isolated from the city itself. The staff was nice, the rooms were okay but the a/c did not work. I notified the front desk 3 times and they promised it was being worked on. Needless to say, it never got fixed on a warm Berlin day and night. If you want a clean room, at a good price this property is okay. Be advised you must take a long tram commute, then a subway ride to wherever you want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lelio
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for five nights in May 2007. The hotel is a new property and the rooms are pretty big, roomy, with modern nice decoration, light slightly scant. The location is not great, but it depends what you are in Berlin for. If you are interested in the Eastern part of the city and the Museuminsel, then it is pretty good. You have one bus stop just outside the hotel, bus number 158, you can take it to the end of line (five or six stops), Michelangelostrasse and take the 200 from there, or the TXL to the airport. You can also use the streetcar, number M2 (frequency 10 min) , that leaves you in Hackescher Markt very near the Museuminsel. Or you can walk about five minutes north and take the streetcar number 12 (frequency 20 min) and it leaves you in Friedrichstrasse. So it is pretty convenient for the whole eastern part of the city. Not so for the western part. It is great to have one supermarket under the hotel and another one just in front of it but the area is not so great for restaurants. My advice: Take the streetcar M2 to either Kollwitzplatz (Station Marienburgerstrasse) or Helmotzplatz (Station Prenzlauer Allee / Danziger Strasse) and you can find plenty of places there. Otherwise the area where the hotel is located is in the north part of Prenzlauer Berg, full of Berliners but not many tourists. The hotel lobby is unimpressive, the minigym just adequate, but the breakfast is ok and the price is also good (paid 90 euros per night for a double room including breakfast through the holiday inn website). Staff is really helpful. Room service is not good but cheap. All in all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, crummy location”
Reviews.Author: blue_who
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel but I didn't like the location at all. From a European hotel perspective this place had massive rooms which were very well appointed. Quite a difference from the rest of Europe. It is however pretty far from everything. I'm not a huge fan of public transport (having done my fair share and not needing to do it anymore) but this place almost forces you to take the U-Bahn around town. Having said that, I do remember that I got a great price here, probably to make up for the lack of location, location, location. Berlin is an absolutely incredible city - the best in Germany for sure and it's too bad that I spent a lot of my time moving around Berlin instead of being able to walk around the city from a more central hotel. Would I stay there again? No. Which is a pity in a way, since it was really a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller_at_heart
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel!! This was the first hotel my partner and i stayed after being on a 18-25's tour around Europe. After an array of poor hotels with the tour, this hotel was absolutely fantastic!! We stayed at about 10 4 star hotels after our tour and this hotel was the best due to its location and quality. It is conveniently located within 5 minutes walk of a train station. The staff are very friendly and helpful and speak reasonably good english. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and come with a decent sized bathroom. The breakfast is absolutely amazing!!! It is a buffet to die for. Make sure you get to breakfast early though, because the juice runs out quickly!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: frskev
Reviews.Content: Arrived with friends and was greeted by friendly and professional reception staff. Throughout the stay they were at all times friendly and helpful with local and hotel information. Rooms were of a good standard with modern and clean decor. Beds comfortable and bathroom large and comfortable. Room TV good, great selection of German and European/US channels. Towels not changed daily unless you leave then in a heap on the flooe. View nothing to write home about but no road noise or disturbances. Breakfast in hotel was excellent with a large choice of fresh food, perhaps the staff could have been quicker with the drinks (tea and coffee). Hotel has a well equipped gym, if only it had a pool/sauna/spa - but then the price would be higher I guess. As for location, for the price it is great, the tram stops right outside and takes you straight to the city centre for a very small fee, runs until late at night. Surrounding area may not look to much but there are some great bars and restaurants nearby in the local squares. We felt entirely comfortable walking around of an evening and found the locals helpful and very courteous. I would return to Berlin and stay here again, good value, good location, good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Not so good location”
Reviews.Author: topbox
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a city break in Berlin and stayed in the Holiday Inn Berlin City Centre East. I would recommend this hotel I found the staff very helpful and easy to get on with. the buffet breakfast was great and the rooms were nice and warm(AND QUIET)however i thought the hotel was too far out and if i was to return to Berlin i would pick a hotel more central.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. location a bit barren”
Reviews.Author: salNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed this lovely hotel and great breakfast. the only problem was that the area is quite far out. althought there is a tram into town across the road. we felt uncomfortable wandering around outside looking for something to eat late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Room Changes”
Reviews.Author: TSW42
Reviews.Content: Arrived and checked in, was put in a different room to what was booked (doubles instead of king at the same cost). Had to argue with the manager to get what I had booked. Was unable to check in till later than expected due to this. The room was very nice. Is next door to a small supermarket and tram lines out the front.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Radisson SAS Berlin the last time I was in Berlin, but chose the Holiday Inn this time because it is near my daughter's apartment. I was very pleased with the cleanliness, the size of the room, and the spacious bathroom. There was a walk-in shower which I had to pay extra for at the Radisson. The breakfast buffet was beautifully presented and offered hot and cold dishes, fruit, cereal, rolls, breads, juice, pancakes, meats, pastries, and more. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The tram and train are nearby, so getting around the city is easy. (There is an underground parking garage if you have a car.) The location is not in a bad area. As one reviewer said, the area is getting better each month as buildings are being renovated. There are many young families in the area. You will see moms and dads pushing strollers or carrying their small children on the backs of their bicycles. I would choose the Holiday Inn over the Radisson because it offers the same amenities for a lot less money. For travelers like me who are sightseeing all day and use the hotel just for sleeping, a shower, and breakfast, it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: driver75
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Holiday Inn City Centre East and was quite satisfied. What I liked: My room was clean and spacious, the bath was even huge. Staff was efficient and friendly. The free WLAN in the lobby is a nice touch that I appreciated a lot. When I made the reservation online I requested a quiet room on a high floor. I called the hotel in the afternoon on the day of arrival and was told that a suitable room had already been pre-blocked. So I got what I wanted despite my late arrival. The room was overlooking the courtyard which means no great view but also no noise from the street. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. What I didn't like: The treadmill in the "mini-gym" was broken. The connecting door to the adjacent room wasn't soundproof at all. I could almost understand what people in the other room were talking about. A few words about the location: While still in the City (Prenzlauer Berg area) the hotel is not very centrally located, but it's definitely not in a bad area! Prenzlauer Berg is traditional residential area. Some buildings are still quite run down due to neglect under the former communist rule, but more and more buildings are being renovated, so it's becoming nicer month by month. It's a few minutes by tram (Strassenbahn) to Alexanderplatz and the tram stops right in front of the hotel. The nearest S-Bahn station (Prenzlauer Allee) is about 5 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, reasonably priced, accepts large groups, rooms not large but in fine decorative order and breakfasts expansive. Good receptionists, reasonably priced drinks and mini-bar. Handily placed 100 yards from metro station. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms...”
Reviews.Author: travelqueens
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within our budget and we were pleasantly surprised to find a nice contemporary, clean, and spacious room. It was fairly easy to get to from the main train station in Berlin, but it does entail using the local subway/train system. Be careful if traveling with little kids as the TV allows you to view clips of pay-per-view channels which may not be suitable for children. Instruct the concierge ahead of time to block out these channels so you do not encounter this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Yes bad serevice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from the city centre in a not to good neighborhood. Impossible no parking coach. The staff is very unfriendly and even rude. This is truthful

Reviews.Title: “bad location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: paul_nl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from the city centre in a not to good neighborhood. The restaurant is just a few tables in the lobby and the bar is the end of the front-desk counter. The staff is very unfriendly and even rude. When you stay in Berlin better stay in hotel that offers more value for money. The Crown Plaza is a good alternitive.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Berlin City Center East-Prenzlauer Allee
HotelInfo.Address: Prenzlauer Allee 169, 10409 Berlin, Germany
